channel.title: Runescape texture dump
channel.description:
I'd like to view the Runescape textures that they use for this game. I've got DatMaker and I know about the dat files located on my computer. I don't know where to go to extract the textures though.
The easiest part would be for me to find a .rar or .zip file that someone has gathered already. I've spent hours of searching and can't seem to find one here or on google.
How do I go about extracting the textures from the game? Can I extract them from a deob'd client? (I'm not expecting high detail ones, iirc that's impossible to get) Are they lumped in with sprites and DatMaker can view them...? etc
Thanks

item.title: Runescape texture dump
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

508 textures there, don’t think they’ve changed an awful lot since then.

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape texture dump
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“Lmao444, post:3, topic:395536”][quote author=HcoJustin link=topic=492733.msg3602457#msg3602457 date=1305744461]
If you want them from the newer cache versions, use the openrs-cachelib and write an application to extract them. If you want the older textures, use Tom’s suite to extract them all.
[/quote]

Is there any way for me to browse the newer cache without writing an application to extract them all? I was hoping a print screen could work.

I have Tom’s suite, but it doesn’t seem to work on newer versions as you said. I’ve got 645 (and higher), but I’m unsure how to get OpenRS Cache to work with it. I know basic java, but not enough to write my own extractor. I’ve written some in other languages but I’m not so sure about java.

Does Tom’s suite only work with clients like 300ish?[/quote]

Tom’s works with 377 and lower, so you’ll have to uses the openrs one if you want it. There used to be a 508 texture dump out there, so you might be able to still find it

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape texture dump
item.dc:creator: @Lmao444 Lmao444
item.description:
@Lmao444 wrote:

HcoJustin:

If you want them from the newer cache versions, use the openrs-cachelib and write an application to extract them. If you want the older textures, use Tom’s suite to extract them all.

Is there any way for me to browse the newer cache without writing an application to extract them all? I was hoping a print screen could work.

I have Tom’s suite, but it doesn’t seem to work on newer versions as you said. I’ve got 645 (and higher), but I’m unsure how to get OpenRS Cache to work with it. I know basic java, but not enough to write my own extractor. I’ve written some in other languages but I’m not so sure about java.

Does Tom’s suite only work with clients like 300ish?

Read full topic
